title.narrative: Yes I Do - Mozambique

description.narrative: In Mozambique KIT is responsible for conducting research on the root causes of child marriage & teenage pregnancies, testing the assumptions of the TOC, and for measuring effectiveness of strategic interventions on child marriages & teenage pregnancies. This means that KIT is responsible for the base and end line studies, the midline and the operational research. KIT closely collaborates with local researchers and capacitates local research teams on mixed methods research and knowledge management. The research has the aim to test the underlying assumptions of the programme’s theory of change, to measure the effectiveness of the interventions introduced by the programme and to look into the interrelations between child marriage and teenage pregnancy and the interventions that address these in Mozambique. The research will contribute to optimization of the Yes I Do intervention strategies and provide context specific knowledge for advocacy and policy purposes, in order to move towards a situation in which adolescent girls can decide if, when and whom to marry and if, when and with whom to have children. Furthermore KIT will lead on the validation and dissemination of research outcomes, and analysing country specific Monitoring & Evaluation data for lessons learned and measuring outcomes and impact of the Yes I do Alliance in Mozambique.

mailing-address.narrative: Mailing address: P.O. Box 95001 1090 HA Amsterdam Visitor address: Mauritskade 63 1092 AD Amsterdam The Netherlands

comment.narrative: One student who re-analyzed baseline data from Malawi, Zambia and Mozambique around the concept of youth agency regarding sexuality and relationships. End report is available.

title.narrative: Operational Research - Identification knowledge gaps

description.narrative: local research partners and implementing partners of YIDA contributed to the output

title.narrative: Identification knowledge gaps and priority setting exercise conducted in consultation with YIDA partners in-country

description.narrative: Exercises to jointly in the YIDA determine what we do not know or for what topic more research is needed

comment.narrative: Identification of the knowledge gap was done on the basis of the baseline study, but also in discussions with different in-country partners either over Skype and or email. The priority setting for the operational research that took place in 2017 was done on the basis of discussions among Yes I Do Mozambique partners, on the basis of the 2016 annual report, as well as discussions over Skype and email.

title.narrative: In-country partners engaged in the process and content of the midline study

description.narrative: Discussion on the process and content of midline study protocol and methodology with in-country partners

comment.narrative: Accomplished: the skeleton proposal for the midline was presented and discussed in December 2017 with the YIDA partners in Mozambique during the annual review. They indicated that the midline research should only take place in Mogovolas district and not in the two other districts where the Yes I Do programme is implemented (Nampula district and Rapale district which were covered in the 2017 (performance assessment). The further developed proposal for the midline was reviewed by the national researcher in Mozambique.

description.narrative: Research protocol extension submitted and approved by local ethical review committee

comment.narrative: Accomplished: ethical approval obtained in 2016 is also applicable for the midline and endline. However, the committee will only issue this in a written letter once the 2016 baseline report will have been submitted into Portuguese. Plan Mozambique is in the process of recruiting a translator for this. New (verbal) approval from local authorities was obtained for the midline

title.narrative: Operational Research - Studies

description.narrative: local research partners contributed to the output

title.narrative: Number of operational research studies conducted

description.narrative: the total number of studies that were conducted on specific topics

comment.narrative: The research was a mixed methods performance study in two districts. Data collection took place between 22 and 6 December 2017. However, in the month of January 2018 a few additional interviews were conducted with various stakeholders in Nampula to fill some data gaps in relation to available health services, economic activities, and meaningful involvement of youth amongst others.

title.narrative: Baseline - Capacity Building data collection

description.narrative: local research partners contributed to the output

title.narrative: The number of researchers and research assistants trained in qualitative and quantitative data collection methods

description.narrative: training of local researchers and research assistants

comment.narrative: Accomplished: all researchers and research assistants received the 3-days training on data collection methods in September 2016. This training was organised two times: one in August 2016 (for intervention area) and one in September (for control area).

title.narrative: Operational Research - Capacity Building data collection

description.narrative: local research partners contributed to the output

title.narrative: The number of researchers and research assistants trained in data collection for the operational research study

description.narrative: training of local researchers and research assistants

comment.narrative: Accomplished: during the data collection training 12 research assistants (8 female and 4 male) were trained. Effort was made to recruit as much as possible the same research assistants who were also involved in the 2016 baseline study. The research assistants received a two-day (refresher) training on the research protocol, research ethics, conducting the survey, conducting interviews/FGDs, and pre-testing of tools at a Secondary School in Nampula. All 12 trained research participants participated in the data collection.

description.narrative: training of local researchers and research assistants

comment.narrative: Accomplished: the data analysis workshop was attended by 4 research assistants and an additional national consultant and two KIT staff. During the workshop some preliminary quantitative data were reviewed, and transcripts of interviews and focus group discussions coded.

title.narrative: The number of researchers and research assistants trained in qualitative data collection methods

description.narrative: training of local researchers and research assistants

comment.narrative: Accomplished: the research team was trained for the data collection for 5 days in May 2018. Besides a formal training at the onset, also the first day of the data collection was used to provide further hands-on training in the field, to enhance the qualitative data collection skills. The training was participated by the national researcher (female), and 4 research assistants (2 female and 2 male) as well as 2 KIT staff
